Issues.Title: vs2022 17.3.5  .net 4.8 c# mdi child form cannot show at centerparent
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/vs2022-1735--net-48-c-mdi-child-for/10158939)._

---
1. vs2022 enterprise 17.3.5  creat c# windowsformsapp（.net framework），use default setup ，framework4.8 

2. add a mdiparent form: MDIParent1 and a  new form :Form1

3. and menu item to call Form1

4. menuitem click code :

Form form1 = new Form1();

            form1.TopLevel = false;

            form1.Parent = this;

            form1.StartPosition=FormStartPosition.CenterScreen;

            form1.Show();

            return;

5. the child form can not be set at the center of the parent screen

---
### Original Comments

#### yx Li on 9/28/2022, 09:18 AM: 

(private comment, text removed)
#### Feedback Bot on 9/28/2022, 11:11 AM: 

(private comment, text removed)
#### Merrie McGaw [MSFT] on 10/6/2022, 08:02 AM: 

(private comment, text removed)
#### Feedback Bot on 10/8/2022, 09:46 AM: 

(private comment, text removed)

---
### Original Solutions
(no solutions)

Issues.Title: Remove duplicate `StatusCommandUI`
Issues.Body:
It appears a genuine porting mistake introduced in #606. `StatusCommandUI` only ever existed under System.Windows.Forms.Design namespace, and the type was later correctly ported in #632.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/194977667-6e94d3c3-08f3-458c-8ab4-06776bda4fd1.png)


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7914)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove duplicate `StatusCommandUI`" (#7914)

Issues.Title: Localized file check-in by OneLocBuild Task: Build definition ID 164: Build ID 2017012
Issues.Body:
This is the pull request automatically created by the OneLocBuild task in the build process to check-in localized files generated based upon translation source files (.lcl files) handed-back from the downstream localization pipeline. If there are issues in translations, visit https://aka.ms/ceLocBug and log bugs for fixes. The OneLocBuild wiki is https://aka.ms/onelocbuild and the localization process in general is documented at https://aka.ms/AllAboutLoc.

Issues.Title: Fix bug in TabPageCollection.RemoveAt (#7837)
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #7837


## Proposed changes

- Fix logic in TabPageCollection.RemoveAt to avoid removing incorrect TabPage when TabControl.Controls collection is out of sync with TabControls._tabPages. This can happen when Control.WmWindowPosChanged calls _parent.UpdateChildControlIndex, which calls Controls.SetChildIndex.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- None

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Low

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Adhoc testing. There's just one of code, and the new implementation calls only public methods.

- Add implicit operators for `Exception` > `HRESULT` and  `ComType.FORMATETC` > `FORMATETC`

Issues.Title: Enable and refactor to fix IDE0031 Use null propagation
Issues.Body:
Used the build in Analyzer's code fix.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/fundamentals/code-analysis/style-rules/ide0031

The analyzer currently is broken and doesn't take into account `#if DEBUG` statements. 
Issue: https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn-analyzers/issues/6197

Related: #7887

Issues.Body:
This is the pull request automatically created by the OneLocBuild task in the build process to check-in localized files generated based upon translation source files (.lcl files) handed-back from the downstream localization pipeline. If there are issues in translations, visit https://aka.ms/ceLocBug and log bugs for fixes. The OneLocBuild wiki is https://aka.ms/onelocbuild and the localization process in general is documented at https://aka.ms/AllAboutLoc.
